types.doc:
CGI helper module for git-http-backend integration

This module provides functionality to handle Git HTTP protocol
by interfacing with git-http-backend CGI script.

class_methods.name: extract_username_from_auth_header

def.name: extract_username_from_auth_header
def.body:
auth_header = env.request.headers["Authorization"]?
if auth_header
else
  return nil
end

if auth_header.starts_with?("Basic ")
  base64 = auth_header.sub("Basic ", "")
  begin
    decoded = Base64.decode_string(base64)
    username, _ = decoded.split(":", 2)
    return username
  rescue ex
    Log.error do "Failed to decode authorization header: #{ex.message}" end
    return nil
  end
end

def.name: prepare_cgi_env
def.body:
repo_name = name.ends_with?(".git") ? name : "#{name}.git"
repo_path = File.expand_path(File.join(Crit::Config::REPO_ROOT, repo_name))

Log.debug do "CGI env preparation" end
Log.debug do "name=#{name}, repo_name=#{repo_name}, path_info=#{path_info}" end
Log.debug do "repo_path=#{repo_path}" end
Log.debug do "request_path=#{env.request.path}" end
Log.debug do "request_method=#{env.request.method}" end

{"GIT_PROJECT_ROOT" => File.expand_path(Crit::Config::REPO_ROOT), "GIT_HTTP_EXPORT_ALL" => "1", "PATH_INFO" => "/#{repo_name}#{path_info}", "REQUEST_METHOD" => env.request.method, "QUERY_STRING" => env.request.query || "", "CONTENT_TYPE" => env.request.headers["Content-Type"]? || "", "REMOTE_USER" => (extract_username_from_auth_header(env)) || "", "REMOTE_ADDR" => (env.request.remote_address.try(&.to_s) || ""), "AUTH_TYPE" => "Basic", "SERVER_PROTOCOL" => env.request.version, "REQUEST_URI" => env.request.resource, "GATEWAY_INTERFACE" => "CGI/1.1", "SERVER_PORT" => (ENV["PORT"]? || "3000"), "SERVER_NAME" => env.request.headers["Host"]? || ""}

class_methods.name: run_git_http_backend

def.name: run_git_http_backend
def.body:
Log.debug do "Running git-http-backend" end



Log.debug do "CGI environment:" end
cgi_env.each do |key, value|
  Log.debug do "  #{key}=#{value}" end
end

io = IO::Memory.new
status = Process.run("git", ["http-backend"], input: (env.request.body || Process::Redirect::Close), output: io, env: cgi_env)

Log.debug do "git-http-backend exit status: #{status.exit_code}" end

io.rewind
raw = io.gets_to_end
Log.debug do "git-http-backend raw output length: #{raw.size}" end

if raw.empty?
  Log.error do "git-http-backend returned empty response" end
  env.response.status_code = 500
  return "Internal Server Error: git-http-backend returned empty response"
end

begin
  header, body = raw.split("\r\n\r\n", 2)
  Log.debug do "git-http-backend header length: #{header.size}" end
  Log.debug do "git-http-backend body length: #{body.size}" end

  header.lines.each do |line|
    Log.debug do "Header line: #{line}" end
    if m = line.match(/^([A-Za-z0-9\-]+):\s*(.+)$/)
      env.response.headers[m[1]] = m[2]
      Log.debug do "Set response header #{m[1]}=#{m[2]}" end
    end
  end
  env.response.print(body)
rescue ex
  Log.error do "Error processing git-http-backend response: #{ex.message}" end
  env.response.status_code = 500
  return "Internal Server Error: #{ex.message}"
end

types.doc:
Repository model class

Provides basic operations for Git repositories such as creation, existence checking, and listing.
This class is responsible for the basic management of repositories,
while actual Git operations are handled by the service layer.

## Example
```
repo = Crit::Models::Repository.new("my-project")
if !repo.exists?
  repo.create
end
```

Ensures the repository directory exists

def.name: ensure_repo_dir
def.body:
begin
  FileUtils.mkdir_p(Crit::Config::REPO_ROOT)
  true
rescue ex
  Log.error do "Failed to create repository directory: #{ex.message}" end
  false
end

Lists all repositories

@return [Array<String>] Array of repository names

def.name: list
def.body:
begin
  (Dir.entries(Crit::Config::REPO_ROOT))
    .select do |name| name.ends_with?(".git") end
    .sort
rescue ex
  Log.error do "Failed to list repositories: #{ex.message}" end
  [] of String
end

class_methods.name: extract_path_info

def.name: setup
def.body:
post("/repo/:name/*") do |env|
  name = env.params.url["name"]
  path_info = extract_path_info(env, name)

  Log.debug do "Handling POST request for repository: #{name}" end
  Log.debug do "Path info: #{path_info}" end

  cgi_env = Crit::Helpers::CGI.prepare_cgi_env(env, name, path_info)
  Crit::Helpers::CGI.run_git_http_backend(env, cgi_env)
end

get("/repo/:name/*") do |env|
  name = env.params.url["name"]
  path_info = extract_path_info(env, name)

  Log.debug do "Handling GET request for repository: #{name}" end
  Log.debug do "Path info: #{path_info}" end

  cgi_env = Crit::Helpers::CGI.prepare_cgi_env(env, name, path_info)
  Crit::Helpers::CGI.run_git_http_backend(env, cgi_env)
end

types.name: Web
types.doc:
Web UI routes module

Handles all web interface routes including repository listing,
creation, and file/directory browsing. This module is responsible
for rendering HTML pages and handling form submissions.

class_methods.name: file_path

def.name: setup
def.body:
get("/") do
  begin
    repos = Crit::Models::Repository.list
    render("views/index.ecr", "views/layout.ecr")
  rescue ex
    Log.error do "Error rendering index page: #{ex.message}" end
    error_response("An error occurred while loading repositories")
  end
end


get("/new") do
  begin
    render("views/new.ecr", "views/layout.ecr")
  rescue ex
    Log.error do "Error rendering new repository form: #{ex.message}" end
    error_response("An error occurred while loading the form")
  end
end


post("/new") do |env|
  begin
    name = env.params.body["name"]?.to_s.strip

    begin
      repo = Crit::Models::Repository.new(name)
    rescue ex : ArgumentError
      next error_response(ex.message, "/new")
    end

    if repo.exists?
      next error_response("Repository already exists", "/new")
    end

    if repo.create
      env.response.headers["Location"] = "/repo/#{name}"
      env.response.status_code = 302
      ""
    else
      error_response("Failed to create repository", "/new")
    end
  rescue ex
    Log.error do "Error creating repository: #{ex.message}" end
    error_response("An unexpected error occurred", "/new")
  end
end


get("/repo/:name") do |env|
  begin
    name = env.params.url["name"]

    begin
      repo = Crit::Models::Repository.new(name)
    rescue ex : ArgumentError
      next error_response(ex.message)
    end

    if !repo.exists?
      next error_response("Repository not found", "/")
    end


    branches = Crit::Services::RepoService.list_branches(name)


    default_branch = if branches.includes?("main")
      "main"
    elsif branches.includes?("master")
      "master"
    else
      branches.first? || "master"
    end


    if branches.empty?
      files = nil
    else
      files = Crit::Services::RepoService.list_files(name, default_branch)


      if files.nil? && !branches.empty?
        next error_response("Failed to list repository files", "/")
      end
    end

    render("views/repo.ecr", "views/layout.ecr")
  rescue ex
    Log.error do "Error rendering repository page: #{ex.message}" end
    error_response("An error occurred while loading repository", "/")
  end
end


get("/repo/:name/tree/:ref/*path") do |env|
  begin
    name = env.params.url["name"]
    ref = env.params.url["ref"]
    path = env.params.url["path"]

    begin
      repo = Crit::Models::Repository.new(name)
    rescue ex : ArgumentError
      next error_response(ex.message)
    end

    if !repo.exists?
      next error_response("Repository not found", "/")
    end

    files = Crit::Services::RepoService.list_files(name, ref, path)
    if !files
      next error_response("Path not found or not a directory", "/repo/#{name}")
    end


    parent_path = path.empty? ? "" : File.dirname(path)
    if parent_path == "."
      parent_path = ""
    end


    branches = Crit::Services::RepoService.list_branches(name)

    render("views/tree.ecr", "views/layout.ecr")
  rescue ex
    Log.error do "Error rendering directory contents: #{ex.message}" end
    error_response("An error occurred while loading directory", "/repo/#{name}")
  end
end


get("/repo/:name/blob/:ref/*path") do |env|
  begin
    name = env.params.url["name"]
    ref = env.params.url["ref"]
    path = env.params.url["path"]

    begin
      repo = Crit::Models::Repository.new(name)
    rescue ex : ArgumentError
      next error_response(ex.message)
    end

    if !repo.exists?
      next error_response("Repository not found", "/")
    end

    content = Crit::Services::RepoService.get_file_content(name, ref, path)
    if !content
      next error_response("File not found", "/repo/#{name}")
    end


    is_binary = (content.includes?("\u0000")) || content.each_byte.any? do |b| ((b < 32 && (b != 9)) && (b != 10)) && (b != 13) end


    parent_path = File.dirname(path)
    if parent_path == "."
      parent_path = ""
    end


    branches = Crit::Services::RepoService.list_branches(name)

    render("views/blob.ecr", "views/layout.ecr")
  rescue ex
    Log.error do "Error rendering file content: #{ex.message}" end
    error_response("An error occurred while loading file", "/repo/#{name}")
  end
end

types.name: RepoService
types.doc:
Repository service class

Provides Git-specific operations for repositories such as listing files,
getting file content, and listing branches. This service layer interacts
with Git commands to perform operations on repositories.

## Example
```
# List files in a repository
files = Crit::Services::RepoService.list_files("my-project", "master")
```

class_methods.name: get_file_content
class_methods.summary: Gets file content for a specific file in a repository
class_methods.args_html: (repo_name : String, ref : String = "master", path : String = "")

def.name: get_file_content
def.body:
begin
  repo_name = repo_name.ends_with?(".git") ? repo_name : "#{repo_name}.git"
  repo_path = File.join(Crit::Config::REPO_ROOT, repo_name)
  if Dir.exists?(repo_path)
  else
    return nil
  end


  if ref.matches?(/^[a-zA-Z0-9_\-\.\/]+$/)
  else
    Log.warn do "Invalid Git reference format: #{ref}" end
    return nil
  end

  if path.matches?(/^[a-zA-Z0-9_\-\.\/]+$/)
  else
    Log.warn do "Invalid path format: #{path}" end
    return nil
  end

  output = IO::Memory.new
  error = IO::Memory.new

  status = Process.run("git", ["--git-dir=#{repo_path}", "show", "#{ref}:#{path}"], output: output, error: error)

  if !status.success?
    error.rewind
    error_message = error.gets_to_end
    Log.error do "Failed to get file content: #{error_message}" end
    return nil
  end


  output.rewind
  output.gets_to_end
rescue ex
  Log.error do "Error getting file content: #{ex.message}" end
  nil
end

class_methods.name: list_branches
class_methods.summary: Gets list of branches for a repository

def.name: list_branches
def.body:
begin
  repo_name = repo_name.ends_with?(".git") ? repo_name : "#{repo_name}.git"
  repo_path = File.join(Crit::Config::REPO_ROOT, repo_name)
  if Dir.exists?(repo_path)
  else
    return [] of String
  end

  output = IO::Memory.new
  error = IO::Memory.new

  status = Process.run("git", ["--git-dir=#{repo_path}", "branch"], output: output, error: error)

  if !status.success?
    error.rewind
    error_message = error.gets_to_end
    Log.error do "Failed to list branches: #{error_message}" end
    return [] of String
  end


  output.rewind
  branches = [] of String

  output.each_line do |line|

    if line =~ (/^\*?\s+(.+)$/)
      branches << $~[1].strip
    end
  end

  branches
rescue ex
  Log.error do "Error listing branches: #{ex.message}" end
  [] of String
end

class_methods.name: list_files
class_methods.summary: Gets file listing for a repository at a specific path and reference
class_methods.args_html: (repo_name : String, ref : String = "master", path : String = "")

def.name: list_files
def.body:
begin
  repo_name = repo_name.ends_with?(".git") ? repo_name : "#{repo_name}.git"
  repo_path = File.join(Crit::Config::REPO_ROOT, repo_name)
  if Dir.exists?(repo_path)
  else
    return nil
  end


  if ref.matches?(/^[a-zA-Z0-9_\-\.\/]+$/)
  else
    Log.warn do "Invalid Git reference format: #{ref}" end
    return nil
  end

  if path.empty? || (path.matches?(/^[a-zA-Z0-9_\-\.\/]+$/))
  else
    Log.warn do "Invalid path format: #{path}" end
    return nil
  end


  path_spec = path.empty? ? "" : "#{path}/"

  output = IO::Memory.new
  error = IO::Memory.new

  status = Process.run("git", ["--git-dir=#{repo_path}", "ls-tree", "#{ref}:#{path_spec}"], output: output, error: error)

  if !status.success?
    error.rewind
    error_message = error.gets_to_end
    Log.error do "Failed to list files: #{error_message}" end
    return nil
  end


  output.rewind
  entries = [] of ::NamedTuple(type: String, mode: String, hash: String, name: String)

  output.each_line do |line|

    if line =~ (/^(\d+)\s+(\w+)\s+([a-f0-9]+)\t(.+)$/)
      mode = $~[1]
      type = $~[2]
      hash = $~[3]
      name = $~[4]
      entries << {type: type, mode: mode, hash: hash, name: name}
    end
  end

  entries
rescue ex
  Log.error do "Error listing files: #{ex.message}" end
  nil
end
